body.description: Body schema for creating a CA

id.description: The unique identifier of this component. Must start with a letter, be lowercase and only contain letters and numbers. If `id` is not provide a component id will be generated using the field `display_name` as the base.

display_name.description: A descriptive name for this CA. The Fabric Operations console tile displays this name.

resources.description: CPU and memory properties. This feature is not available if using a free Kubernetes cluster.

ca.description: This field requires the use of Fabric v1.4.* and higher.

cpu.description: Desired CPU for subcomponent. [Resource details](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-govern-components#ibp-console-govern-components-allocate-resources)

memory.description: Desired memory for subcomponent. [Resource details](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-govern-components#ibp-console-govern-components-allocate-resources)

cpu.description: Maximum CPU for subcomponent. Must be >= "requests.cpu". Defaults to the same value in "requests.cpu". [Resource details](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-govern-components#ibp-console-govern-components-allocate-resources)

memory.description: Maximum memory for subcomponent. Must be >= "requests.memory". Defaults to the same value in "requests.memory". [Resource details](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-govern-components#ibp-console-govern-components-allocate-resources)

storage.description: Disk space properties. This feature is not available if using a free Kubernetes cluster.

class.description: Kubernetes storage class for subcomponent's disk space.

zone.description: Specify the Kubernetes zone for the deployment. The deployment will use a k8s node in this zone. Find the list of possible zones by retrieving your Kubernetes node labels: `kubectl get nodes --show-labels`. [More information](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/best-practices/multiple-zones)

config_override.description:
Set `config_override` to create the root/initial enroll id and enroll secret as well as enabling custom CA configurations (such as using postgres). See the [Fabric CA configuration file](https://hyperledger-fabric-ca.readthedocs.io/en/release-1.4/serverconfig.html) for more information about each parameter.

The field `tlsca` is optional. The Fabric Operations console will copy the value of `config_override.ca` into `config_override.tlsca` if `config_override.tlsca` is omitted (which is recommended).

*The nested field **names** below are not case-sensitive.*

items.description: The origins that will be allowed to use the REST endpoints on the CA (CORS enforcement).

debug.description: Enable debug to debug the CA.

crlsizelimit.description: Max size of an acceptable CRL in bytes

keyfile.description: The CA's private key as base 64 encoded PEM.

certfile.description: The CA's certificate as base 64 encoded PEM.

items.description: The TLS certificate for client TLS as base 64 encoded PEM.

keyfile.description: The CA's private key as base 64 encoded PEM.

certfile.description: The CA's certificate as base 64 encoded PEM.

chainfile.description: The CA's certificate chain as base 64 encoded PEM.

expiry.description: Expiration of the CRL (Certificate Revocation List) generated by the 'gencrl' requests.

maxenrollments.description: Default maximum number of enrollments per id. Set -1 for infinite.

name.description: The ID for the identity, aka enroll id.

pass.description: The password for the identity, aka enroll secret.

maxenrollments.description: Maximum number of enrollments for id. Set -1 for infinite.

affiliation.description: The affiliation data for the identity.

type.description: The type of database. Either 'sqlite3', 'postgres', 'mysql'. Defaults 'sqlite3'.

datasource.description: Build this string - "host=\<hostname> port=\<port> user=\<username> password=\<password> dbname=ibmclouddb sslmode=verify-full"
datasource.example: host=fake.databases.appdomain.cloud port=31941 user=ibm_cloud password=password dbname=ibmclouddb sslmode=verify-full

items.description: The TLS certificate as base 64 encoded PEM.

certfile.description: The TLS certificate for client TLS as base 64 encoded PEM.

keyfile.description: The TLS private key for client TLS as base 64 encoded PEM.

enabled.description: Set to true if TLS is to be used between the CA and its database, else false.

affiliations.description: Set the keys to the desired affiliation parent names. The keys 'org1' and 'org2' are examples.

items.description: The case sensitive name of a child affiliation of 'org1'.
The case sensitive name of a child affiliation of 'org2'.

cn.description: The Common Name for the CSRs.

algo.description: The algorithm to use for CSRs.

size.description: The size of the key for CSRs.

expiry.description: The expiration for the root CA certificate.

pathlength.description: The pathlength field is used to limit CA certificate hierarchy. 0 means that the CA cannot issue CA certs, only entity certificates. 1 means that the CA can issue both.

nonceexpiration.description: Specifies the expiration for the nonces.

noncesweepinterval.description: Specifies frequency at which expired nonces are removed from data store.

config_override.description:
Override the [Fabric Peer configuration file](https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/release-1.4/sampleconfig/core.yaml) if you want use custom attributes to configure the Peer. Omit if not.

*The nested field **names** below are not case-sensitive.*

id.description: A unique id used to identify this instance.

networkId.description: The ID to logically separate one network from another.

keepalive.description: Keep alive settings between the peer server and clients.

minInterval.description: The minimum time between client pings. If a client sends pings more frequently the server disconnects from the client.

interval.description: The time between pings to other peer nodes. Must greater than or equal to the minInterval.

timeout.description: The duration a client waits for a peer's response before it closes the connection.

interval.description: The time between pings to ordering nodes. Must greater than or equal to the minInterval

timeout.description: The duration a client waits for an orderer's response before it closes the connection.

useLeaderElection.description: Decides whether a peer will use a dynamic algorithm for "leader" selection (instead of a static leader). The leader is the peer that establishes a connection with the ordering service (OS). The leader pulls ledger blocks from the OS. It is recommended to use leader election for large networks of peers.

orgLeader.description: Decides whether this peer should be an organization "leader". It maintains a connection with the ordering service and disseminate blocks to peers in its own organization.

membershipTrackerInterval.description: The frequency to poll on membershipTracker.

maxBlockCountToStore.description: Maximum number of blocks that can be stored in memory.

maxPropagationBurstLatency.description: Maximum time between consecutive message pushes.

maxPropagationBurstSize.description: Maximum number of messages that are stored until a push to remote peers is triggered.

propagateIterations.description: Number of times a message is pushed to remote peers.

pullInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pull phases.

pullPeerNum.description: Number of peers to pull from.

requestStateInfoInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pulling stateInfo messages from peers.

publishStateInfoInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pushing stateInfo messages to peers.

stateInfoRetentionInterval.description: Maximum time a stateInfo message is kept.

publishCertPeriod.description: Time after startup to start including certificates in Alive messages.

skipBlockVerification.description: Decides whether the peer should skip the verification of block messages.

dialTimeout.description: The timeout for dialing a network request.

connTimeout.description: The timeout for a network connection.

recvBuffSize.description: Number of received messages to hold in buffer.

sendBuffSize.description: Number of sent messages to hold in buffer.

digestWaitTime.description: Time to wait before the pull-engine processes incoming digests. Should be slightly smaller than requestWaitTime.

requestWaitTime.description: Time to wait before pull-engine removes the incoming nonce. Should be slightly bigger than digestWaitTime.

responseWaitTime.description: Time to wait before the pull-engine ends.

startupGracePeriod.description: Longest time the peer will wait for stable membership during leader election startup.

membershipSampleInterval.description: Frequency that gossip membership samples to check its stability.

leaderAliveThreshold.description: Amount of time after the last declaration message for the peer to perform another leader election.

leaderElectionDuration.description: Amount of time between the peer sending a propose message and it declaring itself as a leader.

pullRetryThreshold.description: Determines the maximum time to attempt to pull private data for a block before that block is committed without the private data.

transientstoreMaxBlockRetention.description: As private data enters the transient store, it is associated with the peer's current ledger's height. This field defines the maximum difference between the current ledger's height on commit, and the private data residing inside the transient store. Private data outside this range is not guaranteed to exist and will be purged periodically.

pushAckTimeout.description: Maximum time to wait for an acknowledgment from each peer's private data push.

btlPullMargin.description: Block to live pulling margin. Used as a buffer to prevent peers from trying to pull private data from others peers that are soon to be purged. "Soon" defined as blocks that will be purged in the next N blocks. This helps a newly joined peer catch up quicker.

reconcileBatchSize.description: Determines the maximum batch size of missing private data that will be reconciled in a single iteration. The process of reconciliation is done in an endless loop. The "reconciler" in each iteration tries to pull from the other peers with the most recent missing blocks and this maximum batch size limitation.

reconcileSleepInterval.description: Determines the time "reconciler" sleeps from the end of an iteration until the beginning of the next iteration.

reconciliationEnabled.description: Determines whether private data reconciliation is enabled or not.

skipPullingInvalidTransactionsDuringComm.description: Controls whether pulling invalid transaction's private data from other peers need to be skipped during the commit time. If `true` it will be pulled through "reconciler".

requiredPeerCount.description: Defines the minimum number of peers to successfully disseminate private data during endorsement.

maxPeerCount.description: Defines the maximum number of peers to attempt to disseminate private data during endorsement.

enabled.description: Controls if the state transfer is enabled or not. If state transfer is active, it syncs up missing blocks and allows lagging peers to catch up with the rest of the network.

checkInterval.description: The frequency to check whether a peer is lagging behind enough to request blocks by using state transfer from another peer.

responseTimeout.description: Amount of time to wait for state transfer responses from other peers.

batchSize.description: Number of blocks to request by using state transfer from another peer.

blockBufferSize.description: Maximum difference between the lowest and highest block sequence number. In order to ensure that there are no holes the actual buffer size is twice this distance.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries of a single state transfer request.

timewindow.description: The maximum acceptable difference between the current server time and the client's time.

BCCSP.description: Configures the Blockchain Crypto Service Providers (bccsp).

Default.description: The name of the crypto library implementation to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp). Defaults to `SW`.

Hash.description: The hash family to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

Security.description: The length of hash to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

connTimeout.description: The timeout for a network connection.

reConnectBackoffThreshold.description: Maximum delay between consecutive connection retry attempts to ordering nodes.

addressOverrides.description: A list of orderer endpoint addresses in channel configurations that should be overridden. Typically used when the original orderer addresses no longer exist.

from.description: The address in the channel configuration that will be overridden.

caCertsFile.description: The path to the CA's cert file.

adminService.description: Used for administrative operations such as control over logger levels. Only peer administrators can use the service.

listenAddress.description: The interface and port on which the admin server will listen on. Defaults to the same address as the peer's listen address and port 7051.

validatorPoolSize.description: Number of go-routines that will execute transaction validation in parallel. By default, the peer chooses the number of CPUs on the machine. It is recommended to use the default values and not set this field.

discovery.description: The discovery service is used by clients to query information about peers. Such as - which peers have joined a channel, what is the latest channel config, and what possible sets of peers satisfy the endorsement policy (given a smart contract and a channel).

enabled.description: Determines whether the discover service is available or not.

authCacheEnabled.description: Determines whether the authentication cache is enabled or not.

authCacheMaxSize.description: Maximum size of the cache. If exceeded a purge takes place.

authCachePurgeRetentionRatio.description: The proportion (0 - 1) of entries that remain in the cache after the cache is purged due to overpopulation.

orgMembersAllowedAccess.description: Whether to allow non-admins to perform non-channel scoped queries. When `false`, it means that only peer admins can perform non-channel scoped queries.

endorserService.description: Limits the number of concurrent requests to the endorser service. The endorser service handles application and system chaincode deployment and invocations (including queries).

deliverService.description: Limits the number of concurrent requests to the deliver service. The deliver service handles block and transaction events.

dynamicLink.description: Controls if golang chaincode should be built with dynamic linking or static linking. Defaults `false` (static).

externalBuilders.description: List of directories to treat as external builders/launches of chaincode.

path.description: The path to a build directory.

name.description: The name of this builder.

items.description: An entry in the environment's white list.

installTimeout.description: Maximum duration to wait for the chaincode build and install process to complete.

startuptimeout.description: Time for starting up a container and waiting for Register to come through.

executetimeout.description: Time for Invoke and Init calls to return. This timeout is used by all chaincodes in all the channels, including system chaincodes. Note that if the image is not available the peer needs to build the image, which will take additional time.

config_override.description:

*The nested fields sent will be merged with the existing settings.*

id.description: A unique id used to identify this instance.

networkId.description: The ID to logically separate one network from another.

keepalive.description: Keep alive settings between the peer server and clients.

minInterval.description: The minimum time between client pings. If a client sends pings more frequently the server disconnects from the client.

interval.description: The time between pings to other peer nodes. Must greater than or equal to the minInterval.

timeout.description: The duration a client waits for a peer's response before it closes the connection.

interval.description: The time between pings to ordering nodes. Must greater than or equal to the minInterval

timeout.description: The duration a client waits for an orderer's response before it closes the connection.

useLeaderElection.description: Decides whether a peer will use a dynamic algorithm for "leader" selection (instead of a static leader). The leader is the peer that establishes a connection with the ordering service (OS). The leader pulls ledger blocks from the OS. It is recommended to use leader election for large networks of peers.

orgLeader.description: Decides whether this peer should be an organization "leader". It maintains a connection with the ordering service and disseminate blocks to peers in its own organization.

body.description: Body schema for creating an ordering service w/raft

orderer_type.description: The type of Fabric orderer. Currently, only the type `"raft"` is supported. [etcd/raft](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-build-network#ibp-console-build-network-ordering-console)

msp_id.description: The MSP id that is related to this component.

cluster_name.description:
A descriptive name for an ordering service. The parent Fabric Operations console tile displays this name.

This field should only be set if you are creating a new OS cluster or when appending to an unknown (external) OS cluster. An unknown/external cluster is one that this Fabric Operations console has not imported or created.

id.description: The unique identifier of this component. Must start with a letter, be lowercase and only contain letters and numbers. If `id` is not provide a component id will be generated using the field `display_name` as the base.

display_name.description: A descriptive base name for each ordering node. One or more child Fabric Operations console tiles display this name.

cluster_id.description:
This field should only be set if you are appending a new raft node to an **existing** raft cluster. When appending to a known (internal) OS cluster set `cluster_id` to the same value used by the OS cluster. When appending to an unknown (external) OS cluster set `cluster_id` to a unique string.

Setting this field means the `config` array should be of length 1, since it is not possible to add multiple raft nodes at the same time in Fabric.

If this field is set the orderer will be "pre-created" and start without a genesis block. It is effectively dead until it is configured. This is the first step to **append** a node to a raft cluster. The next step is to add this node as a consenter to the system-channel by using Fabric-APIs. Then, init this node by sending the updated system-channel config-block with the [Submit config block to orderer](#submit-config-block-to-orderer) API. The node will not be usable until these steps are completed.

external_append.description: Set to `true` only if you are appending to an unknown (external) OS cluster. Else set it to `false` or omit the field. An unknown/external cluster is one that this Fabric Operations console has not imported or created.

config.description:
An array of config objects. When creating a new OS (Ordering Service) the array must have one object per desired raft node. 1 or 5 nodes are recommended.

**When appending to an existing OS only an array of size 1 is supported.**

See this [topic](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-v2-apis#ibp-v2-apis-config) for instructions on how to build a config object.

enrollsecret.description: The password of the enroll id.

items.description:
Override the [Fabric Orderer configuration file](https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/release-1.4/sampleconfig/orderer.yaml) if you want use custom attributes to configure the Orderer. Omit if not.

*The nested field **names** below are not case-sensitive.*

Keepalive.description: Keep alive settings for the GRPC server.

ServerMinInterval.description: The minimum time between client pings. If a client sends pings more frequently the server will disconnect from the client.

ServerInterval.description: The time between pings to clients.

ServerTimeout.description: The duration the server will wait for a response from a client before closing the connection.

BCCSP.description: Configures the Blockchain Crypto Service Providers (bccsp).

Default.description: The name of the crypto library implementation to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp). Defaults to `SW`.

Hash.description: The hash family to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

Security.description: The length of hash to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

Hash.description: The hash family to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

Security.description: The length of hash to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

Authentication.description: Contains configuration parameters that are related to authenticating client messages.

TimeWindow.description: The maximum acceptable difference between the current server time and the client's time.

NoExpirationChecks.description: Indicates if the orderer should ignore expired identities. Should only be used temporarily to recover from an extreme event such as the expiration of administrators. Defaults `false`.

Debug.description: Controls the debugging options for the orderer.

BroadcastTraceDir.description: Path to directory. If set will cause each request to the Broadcast service to be written to a file in this directory.

DeliverTraceDir.description: Path to directory. If set will cause each request to the Deliver service to be written to a file in this directory.

Address.description: The address of the statsd server. Include hostname/ip and port.

WriteInterval.description: The frequency at which locally cached counters and gauges are pushed to statsd.

Prefix.description: The string that is prepended to all emitted statsd metrics.

tls_cert.description:
This field is used by Fabric Operations console when adding the node as a consenter to the system channel. The field indicates what certificate the orderer will use when establishing mutual tls connections between other orderers when acting as the **server or client**. The certificate should be base 64 encoded PEM.

When setting `tls_cert` the fields `client_tls_cert` and `server_tls_cert` are not allowed.

tls_ca_root_cert.description: The TLS CA's root certificate as base 64 encoded PEM.

server_tls_cert.description:
This field is used by Fabric Operations console when adding the node as a consenter to the system channel. The field indicates what certificate the orderer will use when establishing mutual tls connections between other orderers when acting as the **server**. The certificate should be base 64 encoded PEM.

When setting `server_tls_cert` the field `client_tls_cert` is required and `tls_cert` is not allowed.

client_tls_cert.description:
This field is used by Fabric Operations console when adding the node as a consenter to the system channel. The field indicates what certificate the orderer will use when establishing mutual tls connections between other orderers when acting as the **client**. The certificate should be base 64 encoded PEM.

When setting `client_tls_cert` the field `server_tls_cert` is required and `tls_cert` is not allowed.

fabric_get_block_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a get-block transaction. Defaults to `10000` ms (10 seconds). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_instantiate_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a instantiate chaincode transaction. Defaults to `300000` ms (5 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_join_channel_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a join-channel transaction. Defaults to `25000` ms (25 seconds). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_install_cc_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a install chaincode transaction (Fabric v1.x). Defaults to `300000` ms (5 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_lc_install_cc_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a install chaincode transaction (Fabric v2.x). Defaults to `300000` ms (5 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_lc_get_cc_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a get-chaincode transaction (Fabric v2.x). Defaults to `180000` ms (3 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_general_timeout_ms.description: Default maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a Fabric transaction. Defaults to `10000` ms (10 seconds). _Refresh browser after changes_

validation_parameter.description:
Signature policy controlling which orgs must endorse chaincode proposals.

Two formats are supported.
This can be either the name of a channel's signature policy (string) such as:
`"/Channel/Application/Endorsement"`.
Or it can be a signature policy in the peer CLI format (string) such as:
`"AND('Org1.admin', 'Org2.member')"`.

[CLI format docs](https://hyperledgendary.github.io/unstable-fabric-docs/endorsement-policies.html#endorsement-policy-syntax)

items.description: The static collection config (scc) to apply to this chaincode. Conforms to the Fabric message in `peer/collection.proto `.

name.description: Name of the StaticCollectionConfig message

required_peer_count.description: Minimum number of peers that must get the private data to successfully endorse

maximum_peer_count.description: Max number of peers the endorsing peer can try to send private data to

member_orgs_policy.description: Signature policy controlling which orgs must endorse private data changes.

member_only_read.description: If true, only collection member clients can read private data

member_only_write.description: If true, only collection member clients can read private data

endorsement_policy.description:
Signature policy controlling which orgs must endorse chaincode proposals.

Two formats are supported.
This can be either the name of a channel's signature policy (string) such as:
`"/Channel/Application/Endorsement"`.
Or it can be a signature policy in the peer CLI format (string) such as:
`"AND('Org1.admin', 'Org2.member')"`.

[CLI format docs](https://hyperledgendary.github.io/unstable-fabric-docs/endorsement-policies.html#endorsement-policy-syntax)

body.description: Body schema for creating a CA

id.description: The unique identifier of this component. Must start with a letter, be lowercase and only contain letters and numbers. If `id` is not provide a component id will be generated using the field `display_name` as the base.

display_name.description: A descriptive name for this CA. The Fabric Operations console tile displays this name.

resources.description: CPU and memory properties. This feature is not available if using a free Kubernetes cluster.

ca.description: This field requires the use of Fabric v1.4.* and higher.

cpu.description: Desired CPU for subcomponent. [Resource details](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-govern-components#ibp-console-govern-components-allocate-resources)

memory.description: Desired memory for subcomponent. [Resource details](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-govern-components#ibp-console-govern-components-allocate-resources)

cpu.description: Maximum CPU for subcomponent. Must be >= "requests.cpu". Defaults to the same value in "requests.cpu". [Resource details](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-govern-components#ibp-console-govern-components-allocate-resources)

memory.description: Maximum memory for subcomponent. Must be >= "requests.memory". Defaults to the same value in "requests.memory". [Resource details](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-govern-components#ibp-console-govern-components-allocate-resources)

storage.description: Disk space properties. This feature is not available if using a free Kubernetes cluster.

class.description: Kubernetes storage class for subcomponent's disk space.

zone.description: Specify the Kubernetes zone for the deployment. The deployment will use a k8s node in this zone. Find the list of possible zones by retrieving your Kubernetes node labels: `kubectl get nodes --show-labels`. [More information](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/best-practices/multiple-zones)

config_override.description:
Set `config_override` to create the root/initial enroll id and enroll secret as well as enabling custom CA configurations (such as using postgres). See the [Fabric CA configuration file](https://hyperledger-fabric-ca.readthedocs.io/en/release-1.4/serverconfig.html) for more information about each parameter.

The field `tlsca` is optional. The Fabric Operations console will copy the value of `config_override.ca` into `config_override.tlsca` if `config_override.tlsca` is omitted (which is recommended).

*The nested field **names** below are not case-sensitive.*

items.description: The origins that will be allowed to use the REST endpoints on the CA (CORS enforcement).

debug.description: Enable debug to debug the CA.

crlsizelimit.description: Max size of an acceptable CRL in bytes

keyfile.description: The CA's private key as base 64 encoded PEM.

certfile.description: The CA's certificate as base 64 encoded PEM.

items.description: The TLS certificate for client TLS as base 64 encoded PEM.

keyfile.description: The CA's private key as base 64 encoded PEM.

certfile.description: The CA's certificate as base 64 encoded PEM.

chainfile.description: The CA's certificate chain as base 64 encoded PEM.

expiry.description: Expiration of the CRL (Certificate Revocation List) generated by the 'gencrl' requests.

maxenrollments.description: Default maximum number of enrollments per id. Set -1 for infinite.

name.description: The ID for the identity, aka enroll id.

pass.description: The password for the identity, aka enroll secret.

maxenrollments.description: Maximum number of enrollments for id. Set -1 for infinite.

affiliation.description: The affiliation data for the identity.

hf.Registrar.Roles.description: Roles that a registar is allowed to assign to users it registers.

hf.Registrar.DelegateRoles.description: Roles that a registar is allowed to assign to the hf.Registrar.Roles *attribute* for users it registers.

hf.Revoker.description: If `true` this user can revoke certificates.

hf.IntermediateCA.description: If `true` the CA **can** be an intermediate CA.

type.description: The type of database. Either 'sqlite3', 'postgres', 'mysql'. Defaults 'sqlite3'.

datasource.description: Build this string - "host=\<hostname> port=\<port> user=\<username> password=\<password> dbname=ibmclouddb sslmode=verify-full"
datasource.example: host=fake.databases.appdomain.cloud port=31941 user=ibm_cloud password=password dbname=ibmclouddb sslmode=verify-full

items.description: The database TLS certificate as base 64 encoded PEM.

certfile.description: The TLS certificate for client TLS as base 64 encoded PEM.

keyfile.description: The TLS private key for client TLS as base 64 encoded PEM.

enabled.description: Set to true if TLS is to be used between the CA and its database, else false.

affiliations.description: Set the keys to the desired affiliation parent names. The keys 'org1' and 'org2' are examples.

items.description: The case sensitive name of a child affiliation of 'org1'.
The case sensitive name of a child affiliation of 'org2'.

cn.description: The Common Name for the CSRs.

algo.description: The algorithm to use for CSRs.

size.description: The size of the key for CSRs.

expiry.description: The expiration for the root CA certificate.

pathlength.description: The pathlength field is used to limit CA certificate hierarchy. 0 means that the CA cannot issue CA certs, only entity certificates. 1 means that the CA can issue both.

nonceexpiration.description: Specifies the expiration for the nonces.

noncesweepinterval.description: Specifies frequency at which expired nonces are removed from data store.

noncesweepinterval.description: Specifies frequency at which expired nonces are removed from data store.

config_override.description:
Override the [Fabric Peer configuration file](https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/release-1.4/sampleconfig/core.yaml) if you want use custom attributes to configure the Peer. Omit if not.

*The nested field **names** below are not case-sensitive.*

id.description: A unique id used to identify this instance.

networkId.description: The ID to logically separate one network from another.

keepalive.description: Keep alive settings between the peer server and clients.

minInterval.description: The minimum time between client pings. If a client sends pings more frequently the server disconnects from the client.

interval.description: The time between pings to other peer nodes. Must greater than or equal to the minInterval.

timeout.description: The duration a client waits for a peer's response before it closes the connection.

interval.description: The time between pings to ordering nodes. Must greater than or equal to the minInterval

timeout.description: The duration a client waits for an orderer's response before it closes the connection.

useLeaderElection.description: Decides whether a peer will use a dynamic algorithm for "leader" selection (instead of a static leader). The leader is the peer that establishes a connection with the ordering service (OS). The leader pulls ledger blocks from the OS. It is recommended to use leader election for large networks of peers.

orgLeader.description: Decides whether this peer should be an organization "leader". It maintains a connection with the ordering service and disseminate blocks to peers in its own organization.

membershipTrackerInterval.description: The frequency to poll on membershipTracker.

maxBlockCountToStore.description: Maximum number of blocks that can be stored in memory.

maxPropagationBurstLatency.description: Maximum time between consecutive message pushes.

maxPropagationBurstSize.description: Maximum number of messages that are stored until a push to remote peers is triggered.

propagateIterations.description: Number of times a message is pushed to remote peers.

pullInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pull phases.

pullPeerNum.description: Number of peers to pull from.

requestStateInfoInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pulling stateInfo messages from peers.

publishStateInfoInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pushing stateInfo messages to peers.

stateInfoRetentionInterval.description: Maximum time a stateInfo message is kept.

publishCertPeriod.description: Time after startup to start including certificates in Alive messages.

skipBlockVerification.description: Decides whether the peer should skip the verification of block messages.

dialTimeout.description: The timeout for dialing a network request.

connTimeout.description: The timeout for a network connection.

recvBuffSize.description: Number of received messages to hold in buffer.

sendBuffSize.description: Number of sent messages to hold in buffer.

digestWaitTime.description: Time to wait before the pull-engine processes incoming digests. Should be slightly smaller than requestWaitTime.

requestWaitTime.description: Time to wait before pull-engine removes the incoming nonce. Should be slightly bigger than digestWaitTime.

responseWaitTime.description: Time to wait before the pull-engine ends.

startupGracePeriod.description: Longest time the peer will wait for stable membership during leader election startup.

membershipSampleInterval.description: Frequency that gossip membership samples to check its stability.

leaderAliveThreshold.description: Amount of time after the last declaration message for the peer to perform another leader election.

leaderElectionDuration.description: Amount of time between the peer sending a propose message and it declaring itself as a leader.

pullRetryThreshold.description: Determines the maximum time to attempt to pull private data for a block before that block is committed without the private data.

transientstoreMaxBlockRetention.description: As private data enters the transient store, it is associated with the peer's current ledger's height. This field defines the maximum difference between the current ledger's height on commit, and the private data residing inside the transient store. Private data outside this range is not guaranteed to exist and will be purged periodically.

pushAckTimeout.description: Maximum time to wait for an acknowledgment from each peer's private data push.

btlPullMargin.description: Block to live pulling margin. Used as a buffer to prevent peers from trying to pull private data from others peers that are soon to be purged. "Soon" defined as blocks that will be purged in the next N blocks. This helps a newly joined peer catch up quicker.

reconcileBatchSize.description: Determines the maximum batch size of missing private data that will be reconciled in a single iteration. The process of reconciliation is done in an endless loop. The "reconciler" in each iteration tries to pull from the other peers with the most recent missing blocks and this maximum batch size limitation.

reconcileSleepInterval.description: Determines the time "reconciler" sleeps from the end of an iteration until the beginning of the next iteration.

reconciliationEnabled.description: Determines whether private data reconciliation is enabled or not.

skipPullingInvalidTransactionsDuringComm.description: Controls whether pulling invalid transaction's private data from other peers need to be skipped during the commit time. If `true` it will be pulled through "reconciler".

requiredPeerCount.description: Defines the minimum number of peers to successfully disseminate private data during endorsement.

maxPeerCount.description: Defines the maximum number of peers to attempt to disseminate private data during endorsement.

enabled.description: Controls if the state transfer is enabled or not. If state transfer is active, it syncs up missing blocks and allows lagging peers to catch up with the rest of the network.

checkInterval.description: The frequency to check whether a peer is lagging behind enough to request blocks by using state transfer from another peer.

responseTimeout.description: Amount of time to wait for state transfer responses from other peers.

batchSize.description: Number of blocks to request by using state transfer from another peer.

blockBufferSize.description: Maximum difference between the lowest and highest block sequence number. In order to ensure that there are no holes the actual buffer size is twice this distance.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries of a single state transfer request.

timewindow.description: The maximum acceptable difference between the current server time and the client's time.

BCCSP.description: Configures the Blockchain Crypto Service Providers (bccsp).

Default.description: The name of the crypto library implementation to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp). Defaults to `SW`.

Hash.description: The hash family to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

Security.description: The length of hash to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

Hash.description: The hash family to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

Security.description: The length of hash to use for the BlockChain Crypto Service Provider (bccsp)

connTimeout.description: The timeout for a network connection.

reconnectTotalTimeThreshold.description: Total time to spend retrying connections to ordering nodes before giving up and returning an error.

connTimeout.description: The timeout for a network connection.

reConnectBackoffThreshold.description: Maximum delay between consecutive connection retry attempts to ordering nodes.

addressOverrides.description: A list of orderer endpoint addresses in channel configurations that should be overridden. Typically used when the original orderer addresses no longer exist.

from.description: The address in the channel configuration that will be overridden.

caCertsFile.description: The path to the CA's cert file.

adminService.description: Used for administrative operations such as control over logger levels. Only peer administrators can use the service.

listenAddress.description: The interface and port on which the admin server will listen on. Defaults to the same address as the peer's listen address and port 7051.

validatorPoolSize.description: Number of go-routines that will execute transaction validation in parallel. By default, the peer chooses the number of CPUs on the machine. It is recommended to use the default values and not set this field.

discovery.description: The discovery service is used by clients to query information about peers. Such as - which peers have joined a channel, what is the latest channel config, and what possible sets of peers satisfy the endorsement policy (given a smart contract and a channel).

enabled.description: Determines whether the discover service is available or not.

authCacheEnabled.description: Determines whether the authentication cache is enabled or not.

authCacheMaxSize.description: Maximum size of the cache. If exceeded a purge takes place.

authCachePurgeRetentionRatio.description: The proportion (0 - 1) of entries that remain in the cache after the cache is purged due to overpopulation.

orgMembersAllowedAccess.description: Whether to allow non-admins to perform non-channel scoped queries. When `false`, it means that only peer admins can perform non-channel scoped queries.

endorserService.description: Limits the number of concurrent requests to the endorser service. The endorser service handles application and system chaincode deployment and invocations (including queries).

deliverService.description: Limits the number of concurrent requests to the deliver service. The deliver service handles block and transaction events.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the 'Fabric Gateway' on the peer.

cacheSize.description: Maximum size of the cache for CouchDB operations in MB. Defaults to 64MB. Note that if the cache size is not a multiple of 32 MB, the peer will round the size to the next multiple of 32MB.

maxRetriesOnStartup.description: Maximum number of retries for the peer to connect to CouchDB after peer startup. Defaults to 10.

dynamicLink.description: Controls if golang chaincode should be built with dynamic linking or static linking. Defaults `false` (static).

externalBuilders.description: List of directories to treat as external builders/launches of chaincode.

path.description: The path to a build directory.

name.description: The name of this builder.

items.description: An entry in the environment's white list.

installTimeout.description: Maximum duration to wait for the chaincode build and install process to complete.

startuptimeout.description: Time for starting up a container and waiting for Register to come through.

executetimeout.description: Time for Invoke and Init calls to return. This timeout is used by all chaincodes in all the channels, including system chaincodes. Note that if the image is not available the peer needs to build the image, which will take additional time.

system.description: The complete whitelist for system chaincodes. To append a new chaincode add the new id to the default list.

cscc.description: Adds the system chaincode `cscc` to the whitelist.

lscc.description: Adds the system chaincode `lscc` to the whitelist.

escc.description: Adds the system chaincode `escc` to the whitelist.

vscc.description: Adds the system chaincode `vscc` to the whitelist.

qscc.description: Adds the system chaincode `qscc` to the whitelist.

level.description: Default logging level for loggers within chaincode containers.

shim.description: Override default level for the 'shim' logger.

format.description: Override the default log format for chaincode container logs.

provider.description: Metrics provider to use. Can be either 'statsd', 'prometheus', or 'disabled'.

address.description: The address of the statsd server. Include hostname/ip and port.

writeInterval.description: The frequency at which locally cached counters and gauges are pushed to statsd.

prefix.description: The string that is prepended to all emitted statsd metrics.

config_override.description:
Update the [Fabric Peer configuration file](https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/release-1.4/sampleconfig/core.yaml) if you want use custom attributes to configure the Peer. Omit if not.

*The nested field **names** below are not case-sensitive.*
*The nested fields sent will be merged with the existing settings.*

id.description: A unique id used to identify this instance.

networkId.description: The ID to logically separate one network from another.

keepalive.description: Keep alive settings between the peer server and clients.

minInterval.description: The minimum time between client pings. If a client sends pings more frequently the server disconnects from the client.

interval.description: The time between pings to other peer nodes. Must greater than or equal to the minInterval.

timeout.description: The duration a client waits for a peer's response before it closes the connection.

interval.description: The time between pings to ordering nodes. Must greater than or equal to the minInterval

timeout.description: The duration a client waits for an orderer's response before it closes the connection.

useLeaderElection.description: Decides whether a peer will use a dynamic algorithm for "leader" selection (instead of a static leader). The leader is the peer that establishes a connection with the ordering service (OS). The leader pulls ledger blocks from the OS. It is recommended to use leader election for large networks of peers.

orgLeader.description: Decides whether this peer should be an organization "leader". It maintains a connection with the ordering service and disseminate blocks to peers in its own organization.

membershipTrackerInterval.description: The frequency to poll on membershipTracker.

maxBlockCountToStore.description: Maximum number of blocks that can be stored in memory.

maxPropagationBurstLatency.description: Maximum time between consecutive message pushes.

maxPropagationBurstSize.description: Maximum number of messages that are stored until a push to remote peers is triggered.

propagateIterations.description: Number of times a message is pushed to remote peers.

pullInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pull phases.

pullPeerNum.description: Number of peers to pull from.

requestStateInfoInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pulling stateInfo messages from peers.

publishStateInfoInterval.description: Determines the frequency of pushing stateInfo messages to peers.

stateInfoRetentionInterval.description: Maximum time a stateInfo message is kept.

publishCertPeriod.description: Time after startup to start including certificates in Alive messages.

skipBlockVerification.description: Decides whether the peer should skip the verification of block messages.

dialTimeout.description: The timeout for dialing a network request.

connTimeout.description: The timeout for a network connection.

recvBuffSize.description: Number of received messages to hold in buffer.

sendBuffSize.description: Number of sent messages to hold in buffer.

digestWaitTime.description: Time to wait before the pull-engine processes incoming digests. Should be slightly smaller than requestWaitTime.

requestWaitTime.description: Time to wait before pull-engine removes the incoming nonce. Should be slightly bigger than digestWaitTime.

responseWaitTime.description: Time to wait before the pull-engine ends.

startupGracePeriod.description: Longest time the peer will wait for stable membership during leader election startup.

membershipSampleInterval.description: Frequency that gossip membership samples to check its stability.

leaderAliveThreshold.description: Amount of time after the last declaration message for the peer to perform another leader election.

leaderElectionDuration.description: Amount of time between the peer sending a propose message and it declaring itself as a leader.

pullRetryThreshold.description: Determines the maximum time to attempt to pull private data for a block before that block is committed without the private data.

transientstoreMaxBlockRetention.description: As private data enters the transient store, it is associated with the peer's current ledger's height. This field defines the maximum difference between the current ledger's height on commit, and the private data residing inside the transient store. Private data outside this range is not guaranteed to exist and will be purged periodically.

pushAckTimeout.description: Maximum time to wait for an acknowledgment from each peer's private data push.

btlPullMargin.description: Block to live pulling margin. Used as a buffer to prevent peers from trying to pull private data from others peers that are soon to be purged. "Soon" defined as blocks that will be purged in the next N blocks. This helps a newly joined peer catch up quicker.

reconcileBatchSize.description: Determines the maximum batch size of missing private data that will be reconciled in a single iteration. The process of reconciliation is done in an endless loop. The "reconciler" in each iteration tries to pull from the other peers with the most recent missing blocks and this maximum batch size limitation.

reconcileSleepInterval.description: Determines the time "reconciler" sleeps from the end of an iteration until the beginning of the next iteration.

reconciliationEnabled.description: Determines whether private data reconciliation is enabled or not.

skipPullingInvalidTransactionsDuringComm.description: Controls whether pulling invalid transaction's private data from other peers need to be skipped during the commit time. If `true` it will be pulled through "reconciler".

requiredPeerCount.description: Defines the minimum number of peers to successfully disseminate private data during endorsement.

maxPeerCount.description: Defines the maximum number of peers to attempt to disseminate private data during endorsement.

enabled.description: Controls if the state transfer is enabled or not. If state transfer is active, it syncs up missing blocks and allows lagging peers to catch up with the rest of the network.

checkInterval.description: The frequency to check whether a peer is lagging behind enough to request blocks by using state transfer from another peer.

responseTimeout.description: Amount of time to wait for state transfer responses from other peers.

batchSize.description: Number of blocks to request by using state transfer from another peer.

blockBufferSize.description: Maximum difference between the lowest and highest block sequence number. In order to ensure that there are no holes the actual buffer size is twice this distance.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries of a single state transfer request.

timewindow.description: The maximum acceptable difference between the current server time and the client's time.

connTimeout.description: The timeout for a network connection.

reconnectTotalTimeThreshold.description: Total time to spend retrying connections to ordering nodes before giving up and returning an error.

connTimeout.description: The timeout for a network connection.

reConnectBackoffThreshold.description: Maximum delay between consecutive connection retry attempts to ordering nodes.

addressOverrides.description: A list of orderer endpoint addresses in channel configurations that should be overridden. Typically used when the original orderer addresses no longer exist.

from.description: The address in the channel configuration that will be overridden.

caCertsFile.description: The path to the CA's cert file.

adminService.description: Used for administrative operations such as control over logger levels. Only peer administrators can use the service.

listenAddress.description: The interface and port on which the admin server will listen on. Defaults to the same address as the peer's listen address and port 7051.

validatorPoolSize.description: Number of go-routines that will execute transaction validation in parallel. By default, the peer chooses the number of CPUs on the machine. It is recommended to use the default values and not set this field.

discovery.description: The discovery service is used by clients to query information about peers. Such as - which peers have joined a channel, what is the latest channel config, and what possible sets of peers satisfy the endorsement policy (given a smart contract and a channel).

enabled.description: Determines whether the discover service is available or not.

authCacheEnabled.description: Determines whether the authentication cache is enabled or not.

authCacheMaxSize.description: Maximum size of the cache. If exceeded a purge takes place.

authCachePurgeRetentionRatio.description: The proportion (0 - 1) of entries that remain in the cache after the cache is purged due to overpopulation.

orgMembersAllowedAccess.description: Whether to allow non-admins to perform non-channel scoped queries. When `false`, it means that only peer admins can perform non-channel scoped queries.

endorserService.description: Limits the number of concurrent requests to the endorser service. The endorser service handles application and system chaincode deployment and invocations (including queries).

deliverService.description: Limits the number of concurrent requests to the deliver service. The deliver service handles block and transaction events.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the 'Fabric Gateway' on the peer.

cacheSize.description: Maximum size of the cache for CouchDB operations in MB. Defaults to 64MB. Note that if the cache size is not a multiple of 32 MB, the peer will round the size to the next multiple of 32MB.

maxRetriesOnStartup.description: Maximum number of retries for the peer to connect to CouchDB after peer startup. Defaults to 10.

dynamicLink.description: Controls if golang chaincode should be built with dynamic linking or static linking. Defaults `false` (static).

externalBuilders.description: List of directories to treat as external builders/launches of chaincode.

path.description: The path to a build directory.

name.description: The name of this builder.

items.description: An entry in the environment's white list.

installTimeout.description: Maximum duration to wait for the chaincode build and install process to complete.

startuptimeout.description: Time for starting up a container and waiting for Register to come through.

executetimeout.description: Time for Invoke and Init calls to return. This timeout is used by all chaincodes in all the channels, including system chaincodes. Note that if the image is not available the peer needs to build the image, which will take additional time.

system.description: The complete whitelist for system chaincodes. To append a new chaincode add the new id to the default list.

cscc.description: Adds the system chaincode `cscc` to the whitelist.

lscc.description: Adds the system chaincode `lscc` to the whitelist.

escc.description: Adds the system chaincode `escc` to the whitelist.

vscc.description: Adds the system chaincode `vscc` to the whitelist.

qscc.description: Adds the system chaincode `qscc` to the whitelist.

level.description: Default logging level for loggers within chaincode containers.

shim.description: Override default level for the 'shim' logger.

format.description: Override the default log format for chaincode container logs.

provider.description: Metrics provider to use. Can be either 'statsd', 'prometheus', or 'disabled'.

address.description: The address of the statsd server. Include hostname/ip and port.

writeInterval.description: The frequency at which locally cached counters and gauges are pushed to statsd.

prefix.description: The string that is prepended to all emitted statsd metrics.

body.description: Body schema for creating an ordering service w/raft

orderer_type.description: The type of Fabric orderer. Currently, only the type `"raft"` is supported. [etcd/raft](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-console-build-network#ibp-console-build-network-ordering-console)

msp_id.description: The MSP id that is related to this component.

cluster_name.description:
A descriptive name for an ordering service. The parent Fabric Operations console tile displays this name.

This field should only be set if you are creating a new OS cluster or when appending to an unknown (external) OS cluster. An unknown/external cluster is one that this Fabric Operations console has not imported or created.

id.description: The unique identifier of this component. Must start with a letter, be lowercase and only contain letters and numbers. If `id` is not provide a component id will be generated using the field `display_name` as the base.

display_name.description: A descriptive base name for each ordering node. The Fabric Operations console tile displays this name.

cluster_id.description:
This field should only be set if you are appending a new raft node to an **existing** raft cluster. When appending to a known (internal) OS cluster set `cluster_id` to the same value used by the OS cluster. When appending to an unknown (external) OS cluster set `cluster_id` to a unique string.

Setting this field means the `config` array should be of length 1, since it is not possible to add multiple raft nodes at the same time in Fabric.

If this field is set the orderer will be "pre-created" and start without a genesis block. It is effectively dead until it is configured. This is the first step to **append** a node to a raft cluster. The next step is to add this node as a consenter to the system-channel by using Fabric-APIs. Then, init this node by sending the updated system-channel config-block with the [Submit config block to orderer](#submit-block) API. The node will not be usable until these steps are completed.

external_append.description: Set to `true` only if you are appending to an unknown (external) OS cluster. Else set it to `false` or omit the field. An unknown/external cluster is one that this Fabric Operations console has not imported or created.

crypto.description:
An array of config objects. When creating a new OS (Ordering Service) the array must have one object per desired raft node. 1 or 5 nodes are recommended.

**When appending to an existing OS only an array of size 1 is supported.**

See this [topic](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-v2-apis#ibp-v2-apis-config) for instructions on how to build a config object.

items.description: See this [topic](/docs/blockchain?topic=blockchain-ibp-v2-apis#ibp-v2-apis-config) for instructions on how to build a crypto object.

body.description: Body schema to edit Fabric Operations console settings. Each setting field is optional.

auth_scheme.description: The type of auth to use to authorize users. Valid choices are "iam", "couchdb", and "oauth".

authorization_url.description: The url of the OAuth2.0 service to send the user for authorization/login.

token_url.description: The url of the OAuth2.0 service to exchange an authorizatoin code for an access token.

client_id.description: Credentials to use the OAuth2.0 service.

client_secret.description: Credentials to use the OAuth2.0 service.

scope.description: The scopes to ask for when using the OAuth2.0 service. Multiple scopes should be separated with spaces.

debug.description: If true the server logs will contain extra user information during login. This is useful to have when debugging issues when setting up oauth.

admin_contact_email.description: The email address of the owner of this console.

default_user_password.description: This is the password a user would use when they login to the console for the first time.

allow_default_password.description: If true users will be allowed to keep the default password and will not be prompted to change it on their first login.

enabled.description: Indicates if the auto log out logic is enabled or disabled. Defaults `false`. _Refresh browser after changes_

max_idle_time.description: Maximum time in milliseconds for a browser client to be idle. Once exceeded the user is logged out. Defaults to `90000` ms (1.5 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

file_logging.description: File system logging settings. All body fields are optional (only send the fields that you want to change). _Changes to this field will restart the Fabric Operations console server(s)_

client.description: The client side (browser) logging settings. _Changes to this field will restart the Fabric Operations console server(s)_

enabled.description: If `true` logging will be stored to a file on the file system.

unique_name.description: If `true` log file names will have a random suffix.

server.description: The server side logging settings. _Changes to this field will restart the Fabric Operations console server(s)_

enabled.description: If `true` logging will be stored to a file on the file system.

unique_name.description: If `true` log file names will have a random suffix.

max_req_per_min.description: The base limit for the maximum number of `/api/*` API requests (aka UI requests) in 1 minute. Defaults `25`. [Rate Limits](#rate-limits). _Changes to this field will restart the Fabric Operations console server(s)_

max_req_per_min_ak.description: The base limit for the maximum number of `/ak/api/*` API requests (aka external api key requests) in 1 minute. Defaults `25`. [Rate Limits](#rate-limits). _Changes to this field will restart the Fabric Operations console server(s)_

fabric_get_block_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a get-block transaction. Defaults to `10000` ms (10 seconds). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_instantiate_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a instantiate chaincode transaction. Defaults to `300000` ms (5 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_join_channel_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a join-channel transaction. Defaults to `25000` ms (25 seconds). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_install_cc_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a install chaincode transaction (Fabric v1.x). Defaults to `300000` ms (5 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_lc_install_cc_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a install chaincode transaction (Fabric v2.x). Defaults to `300000` ms (5 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_lc_get_cc_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a get-chaincode transaction (Fabric v2.x). Defaults to `180000` ms (3 minutes). _Refresh browser after changes_

fabric_general_timeout_ms.description: Default maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a Fabric transaction. Defaults to `10000` ms (10 seconds). _Refresh browser after changes_

msp_id.description: The msp of the identity that created the authorization header.

certificate.description: The matching certificate for the identity that created the authorization header. Base 64 encoded PEM.

hash_ver.description: The version of the hash function over this request. Fabric Operations consoles v2.5.* and higher should use "v2".

ccd.description: **(exclusive param for ccd txs)** The chaincode definition that needs to be approved.

chaincode_sequence.description: Tracks the number of times a chaincode def has been defined or updated

endorsement_plugin.description: The system chaincode id/name to use to check endorsements

init_required.description: Controls if the first invoke should be "init" or not

validation_plugin.description: The system chaincode id/name to use to validate

validation_parameter.description:
Signature policy controlling which orgs must endorse chaincode proposals.

Two formats are supported.
This can be either the name of a channel's signature policy (string) such as:
`"/Channel/Application/Endorsement"`.
Or it can be a signature policy in the peer CLI format (string) such as:
`"AND('Org1.admin', 'Org2.member')"`.

[CLI format docs](https://hyperledgendary.github.io/unstable-fabric-docs/endorsement-policies.html#endorsement-policy-syntax)

items.description: The static collection config (scc) to apply to this chaincode. Conforms to the Fabric message in `peer/collection.proto `.

name.description: Name of the StaticCollectionConfig message

required_peer_count.description: Minimum number of peers that must get the private data to successfully endorse

maximum_peer_count.description: Max number of peers the endorsing peer can try to send private data to

member_orgs_policy.description: Signature policy controlling which orgs must endorse private data changes.

member_only_read.description: If true, only collection member clients can read private data

member_only_write.description: If true, only collection member clients can read private data

endorsement_policy.description:
Signature policy controlling which orgs must endorse chaincode proposals.

Two formats are supported.
This can be either the name of a channel's signature policy (string) such as:
`"/Channel/Application/Endorsement"`.
Or it can be a signature policy in the peer CLI format (string) such as:
`"AND('Org1.admin', 'Org2.member')"`.

[CLI format docs](https://hyperledgendary.github.io/unstable-fabric-docs/endorsement-policies.html#endorsement-policy-syntax)
